docs.abstract: LEAD: Buddhist rebels shot and killed five Moslem settlers and wounded three others in an ambush Saturday on a ferry in southern Bangladesh, the police said today. The rebels opposed a Government program resettling Moslems from the plains to hilly land. They attacked a boat ferrying 50 settlers near the hill town of Rangamati, about 120 miles southeast of Dhaka, a police officer said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Buddhist rebels shot and killed five Moslem settlers and wounded three others in an ambush Saturday on a ferry in southern Bangladesh, the police said today. The rebels opposed a Government program resettling Moslems from the plains to hilly land. They attacked a boat ferrying 50 settlers near the hill town of Rangamati, about 120 miles southeast of Dhaka, a police officer said.

docs.abstract: LEAD: It is not easy being a Bangladeshi these days. While our country is going under - literally and figuratively - the international community has responded with generous aid as well as a strong dose of cynicism and sarcasm. Ever since Henry Kissinger dehumanized Bangladesh by labeling it ''an international basket case,'' Bangladesh has been the butt of many cruel jokes.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is not easy being a Bangladeshi these days. While our country is going under - literally and figuratively - the international community has responded with generous aid as well as a strong dose of cynicism and sarcasm. Ever since Henry Kissinger dehumanized Bangladesh by labeling it ''an international basket case,'' Bangladesh has been the butt of many cruel jokes.

docs.abstract: LEAD: A Bangladeshi Air Force corporal shot and killed 8 people and wounded 50 others when he opened fire with a submachine gun in a mosque at Jessore air base and then killed himself, military officials said today. The officials declined to identify the man and could not provide a motive for the killings Tuesday night.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Bangladeshi Air Force corporal shot and killed 8 people and wounded 50 others when he opened fire with a submachine gun in a mosque at Jessore air base and then killed himself, military officials said today. The officials declined to identify the man and could not provide a motive for the killings Tuesday night.

docs.abstract: LEAD: At least 40 people, including six children, were wounded when were bombs set off by robbers at a rural fair, the police said today. More than 20 bombs went off Friday during a fair in the village of Kaliakandipara in Sirajganj district, about 50 miles northwest of Dhaka, according to police officials.
docs.lead_paragraph: At least 40 people, including six children, were wounded when were bombs set off by robbers at a rural fair, the police said today. More than 20 bombs went off Friday during a fair in the village of Kaliakandipara in Sirajganj district, about 50 miles northwest of Dhaka, according to police officials. A 7-year-old boy and five adults were critically injured, they said. Officers said many stalls set up by traders were robbed, but the amount of money and goods taken was not known. The robbers escaped, they said.

docs.abstract: LEAD: The police clashed today with demonstrators protesting a constitutional amendment that made Islam the state religion. The authorities said 50 people suffered minor injuries. The demonstrations coincided with a one-day strike called to protest the new law, passed Tuesday by Parliament and signed into law by President H.
docs.lead_paragraph: The police clashed today with demonstrators protesting a constitutional amendment that made Islam the state religion. The authorities said 50 people suffered minor injuries. The demonstrations coincided with a one-day strike called to protest the new law, passed Tuesday by Parliament and signed into law by President H. M. Ershad.

docs.abstract: LEAD: Army troops mounted a big rescue operation today after the death toll in annual floods rose to at least 121 people, forcing large-scale evacuation. At least 5 million people have been affected. An official at the Relief Ministry said soldiers were moving marooned people to safer areas but that rescue operations were difficult in the northeastern district of Sunamganj because all the roads were under deep water.
docs.lead_paragraph: Army troops mounted a big rescue operation today after the death toll in annual floods rose to at least 121 people, forcing large-scale evacuation. At least 5 million people have been affected. An official at the Relief Ministry said soldiers were moving marooned people to safer areas but that rescue operations were difficult in the northeastern district of Sunamganj because all the roads were under deep water. There is no dry surface to land helicopters, he said, and the flooding has made the dropping of food packages nearly impossible.

docs.abstract: LEAD: Floods set off by heavy rains have killed more than 80 people in Bangladesh and authorities have declared a disaster alert, officials said today. They said 33 people were killed on Friday when houses collapsed and a boat ferrying flood victims capsized in the Jamuna River. Thirty-two inches of rain have fallen in northern Bangladesh in the last three days, flooding 21 of the country's 64 districts.
docs.lead_paragraph: Floods set off by heavy rains have killed more than 80 people in Bangladesh and authorities have declared a disaster alert, officials said today. They said 33 people were killed on Friday when houses collapsed and a boat ferrying flood victims capsized in the Jamuna River. Thirty-two inches of rain have fallen in northern Bangladesh in the last three days, flooding 21 of the country's 64 districts.

docs.abstract: LEAD: At least five people have died and thousands have been forced to flee their homes because of flooding in northeastern Bangladesh, Government officials and news reports said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: At least five people have died and thousands have been forced to flee their homes because of flooding in northeastern Bangladesh, Government officials and news reports said today.

docs.abstract: LEAD: At least two people were killed and more than 100 injured Saturday night when a moderate earthquake shook Bangladesh and eastern India. The Government newspaper Dainik Bangla reported today that the deaths and most of the injuries occurred in the northeastern city of Sylhet. Walls of houses caved in around Slyhet, cracks opened up in a hospital building containing 500 beds and people ran into the streets in panic, the newspaper said.
docs.lead_paragraph: At least two people were killed and more than 100 injured Saturday night when a moderate earthquake shook Bangladesh and eastern India. The Government newspaper Dainik Bangla reported today that the deaths and most of the injuries occurred in the northeastern city of Sylhet. Walls of houses caved in around Slyhet, cracks opened up in a hospital building containing 500 beds and people ran into the streets in panic, the newspaper said. The weather office in Dhaka described the tremor as ''moderate,'' but no exact reading of its intensity was available.

docs.abstract: LEAD: Reports of illness and deaths from gastrointestinal diseases began to rise suddenly today, increasing fears of an epidemic even as the waters of this country's devastating flood continue to recede.
docs.lead_paragraph: Reports of illness and deaths from gastrointestinal diseases began to rise suddenly today, increasing fears of an epidemic even as the waters of this country's devastating flood continue to recede.

headline.main: Deaths and Illness Rise in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: Deaths and Illness Rise in Bangladesh

byline.original: By Barbara Crossette, Special To the New York Times
